core

Class AbstractMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AbstractComponent
      • core.AbstractMethod

  • public abstract class AbstractMethod
extends AbstractComponent
    Abstract superclass for Method components. Methods are used to iteratively optimize a given set of AbstractRepresentations. They implement the Runnable interface meaning the algorithm will be executed on a separate thread.

    Methods can save obtained results any time by calling the FrevoMain#saveResult(String, AbstractMethod) static method.

    Author:
    Istvan Fehervari

        public abstract void runOptimization(ProblemXMLData problemData,
                   ComponentXMLData representationData,
                   ComponentXMLData rankingData,
                   java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,XMLFieldEntry> properties)
        Runs the optimization method
        Parameters:
        problemData - defines the problem class and its configuration
        representationData - defines the representation class and its configuration
        rankingData - defines the ranking class and its configuration
        properties - the configuration of the optimizer

      • continueOptimization

        public void continueOptimization(ProblemXMLData problemData,
                        ComponentXMLData representationData,
                        ComponentXMLData rankingData,
                        java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,XMLFieldEntry> properties,
                        org.dom4j.Document doc)
        Continues the experiment from the last saved state.
        Parameters:
        problemData - defines the problem class and its configuration
        representationData - defines the representation class and its configuration
        rankingData - defines the ranking class and its configuration
        properties - the configuration of the optimizer
        doc - information in XML format about last completed step of evolutionary process

      • getProgress

        public final float getProgress()
        Returns the current progress of this method mostly for display purposes.
        Returns:
        a float value between 0 and 1

      • setProgress

        public static final void setProgress(float p)
        Sets the progress of this method the given value. This value is used by the assigned worker thread mostly for display purposed and it is between 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        p - The new progress value to be used.

      • getRandom

        public final long getSeed()

        Returns:

      • loadFromXML

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<AbstractRepresentation>> loadFromXML(org.dom4j.Document doc)
        Load representations from a results XML doc object. The representations are arranged as a list of populations where each population is represented as a list of representations (or solutions).

        If the loading takes considerable amount of time it is advised to provide visual feedback to the user. This can be done by calling the FrevoMain.setLoadingProgress(float) method.

        Parameters:
        doc - The source Document to be used for loading the representations.
        Returns:
        A 2D array of AbstractRepresentations loaded from the source document.

      • getLastResults

        public final XMLMethodStep getLastResults()
        Gets the latest results from Method evaluation. This method is important for the function which allows to save the last state, because it's possible to continue evaluation from the last saved state.
        Returns:
        object which contains results of evaluation for last generation. If Method doesn't support saving it should return null.

      • canContinue

        public final boolean canContinue()
        Gets the possibility of continuation of the experiment
        Returns:
        true if experiment can be continued, otherwise - false
